definition: to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: Above term only apply to dorsa above3,000 bales.
sentences.chinese: 以上條件，僅適用於三千捆以上的訂單。

sentences.english: He needs the specific dates their componets orders were placed last month.
sentences.chinese: 他要他們上個月提出的機件訂單的詳細日期。

sentences.english: We thank you for your order, which have be putted in work at once.
sentences.chinese: 感謝您的訂單，我們立即予以執行。

sentences.english: On-line order and signup for online trial.
sentences.chinese: 網上訂單和註冊爲在線試用。

sentences.english: If you order in the morning, we have more than four hours.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是在白天發的訂單，就會超過四個小時。

sentences.english: What name is the order listed under?
sentences.chinese: 下訂單的人叫什麼名字？

sentences.english: Please countermand our order for same.
Homebuilding orders are up by a fifth on a year ago.
sentences.chinese: 房地產開發訂單在一年前更是提升了五分之一。

sentences.english: Some floral shops accept orders for flowers and gifts to be sent to anywhere around the globe.
sentences.chinese: 有一些花店可以接受訂單把花和禮物送住全球各地。

sentences.english: New Boat 600 aircraft has now been 16 domestic and international orders.
sentences.chinese: 新舟600飛機現已獲得國際國內訂單16架。

sentences.english: We are pleased to receive your order of 16th June for cotton prints .
sentences.chinese: 很高興接到你方6月16日印花棉布的訂單。

sentences.english: Each order contains 2 packs of 96 tablets at one flat shipping rate.
sentences.chinese: 每個訂單包含96片2包在一個單位出貨率。

sentences.english: Create a new order by posting an XML entity to a service.
sentences.chinese: 通過向服務發送一個XML實體來創建一個新訂單。

sentences.english: A reservation of material based on an accepted order or system generated planned order.
sentences.chinese: 根據已接受訂單或系統生成計劃訂單預留物料。

sentences.english: A reservation of material based on an accepted order or system generated planned order.
sentences.chinese: 根據已接受訂單或系統生成計劃訂單預留物料。

sentences.english: Please let us know what the full quantity of your order is.
sentences.chinese: 請惠知本公司貴方訂單的總數。

definition: to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
property or cash held in reserve/stock
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
